name: Dreco

attributes.attribute: described as monstrous in the Book Of Invasions
used a poison draught to kill 20 warriors sent against her
overlooking Lough Conn in Co. Mayo
described as a Bard as well as a magician

sources: Gwynn, Edward. The Metrical Dindshenchas. Royal Irish Academy, Todd Lecture Series. Dublin: Hodges, Figgis, and Co., Ltd., 1906–1924, 15.
Monaghan, Patricia. The Encyclopedia of Celtic Mythology and Folklore. Checkmark Books, 2008.
text: Irish mythology tells of Dreco, a notable figure among the Fomorians, a race of beings considered monstrous in the Book of Invasions. As an accomplished sorceress and Bard, Dreco once defeated a group of 20 warriors sent to capture her using a lethal potion. Her impressive achievement took place in the esteemed location of Nephin (Nemthend) with a view of Lough Conn in Co. Mayo. Irish place-name poetry provides insight into this historic event, further portraying the legendary reputation of Dreco.
